definition: to become moist again/to revive (usually of sth bad)/resurgence
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Used for testing the regain percentage of raw cotton quickly.
sentences.chinese: 用于快速测定原棉回潮率。

sentences.english: Bamboo char fiber is a kind of lower strength and lower elongation fiber, it has higher moisture regain.
sentences.chinese: 竹炭纤维是一种低强低伸型纤维，具有较高的回潮率。

sentences.english: Used for testing the regain per- centage of raw cotton quickly.
sentences.chinese: 用于快速测定原棉回潮率。

sentences.english: With the revival of national customary law, the phenomenon attached much attention.
sentences.chinese: 随着民族习惯法的回潮，该现象再次引起社会的关注。

sentences.english: It on-line tests various sizing moisture regains. It is applicable for differ…
sentences.chinese: 在线检测各类浆纱回潮率，适用于各类型浆纱机。

sentences.english: There is a revival of superstitious practices in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 农村迷信活动有所回潮。

sentences.english: But she has noticed the return of the floral skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她也注意到了碎花裙的回潮。

sentences.english: Concubinage has made a come back in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 而最近这些年，纳妾之风似乎有回潮的趋势。

sentences.english: The regain of textile materials get from the oven method is related to atmospheric condition in which the oven is placed.
sentences.chinese: 烘箱法测定的回潮率与烘箱所置的大气条件有关。

sentences.english: It on-line tests various sizing moisture regains. It is applicable for different categories sizing machines.
sentences.chinese: 在线检测各类浆纱回潮率，适用于各类型浆纱机。

sentences.english: After a half century of neglect, the lowly single is back on top.
sentences.chinese: 经过半个世纪的忽视，单曲低调的的回潮。

definition: tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
lit. ashes burn once more (idiom); fig. sb lost returns to have influence/sth malevolent returns to haunt one

to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to be in vogue/to be prevalent
(of a contagious disease etc) to spread/to propagate/(of a style of clothing, song etc) popular/fashionable
old-fashioned/out of date/to be later than the time stipulated or agreed upon
